issue.title: ECIP validation fixes and CI improvements
issue.body:
Builds from #305 

Fixes all ECIP document validation issues and gets the CI suite to pass (and includes a new workflow `ECIP Validation` which validates ECIP document formats on `pull_request` and `push`). So we can depend on CI validation and deploy workflow as a requirement for merging PRs, for example.

Includes change sets:
- fix(Gemfile.lock): bundle update and fix nokogiri security alert #302
- fix(ecip1082): character that cannot start any token, line 5, col 9 #304
- CI update for ECIP validation #305 

Fixes #292 

As you'll see in those individual PRs I've noted that this PR includes and then extends from them.
If anyone wants to reopen those more granular changes please just say so and we can do that. Fixing the ECIP documents for the validator to pass meant tweaking and fixing frontmatter fields and values, but otherwise no actual content was edited, and I tried to mess as little with the frontmatters as possible, eg.
- https://github.com/ethereumclassic/ECIPs/pull/306/commits/dc20abfe315acd1c6213f686b643101824e821cf
- https://github.com/ethereumclassic/ECIPs/pull/306/commits/431d7f8b6cfebb7fc1dba8c117e240db94368ac4
- https://github.com/ethereumclassic/ECIPs/pull/306/commits/7a6a9a517fda9254422269fa957837aad62ac133

The new validator can be found here: https://github.com/meowsbits/ecip_validator and is published with rubygems here https://rubygems.org/gems/ecip_validator. As mentioned in #305, if there's interest in pushing forward a community-development version, I'd be happy to transfer it to github.com/ethereumclassic/.
